root.title: Chaa-Hol IV (e-16)
root.place: Monuments of this group were found in a valley near the river Chaa-Hol, the left inflow of Ulug-Hem, in 25 km above the mouth of river Hemchik. This district is on the bottom of water basin Sayano-Shushenskii now. All monuments of the group, except Е 15, are in museum exhibitions.
root.store: Taken out to Helsingfors. Stored in the National museum of Helsinki.
root.general: The stele is made from sandstone. Rectangular in section, sides are precisely expressed.
root.description: The inscription of 3 lines, is located vertically on three sides. There is a tamga below the line 1 .
root.investigation: Aspelin found in 1888, according to the message of Safyanov. The stone is copied by Heikel.

pdf.f_title: Памятники тюркской рунической письменности азиатского ареала.
